title: How to Make a Lemonade Slushie

steps.headline: In a blender, blend the lemon, water, and sugar.
steps.description: Blend until well-combined and properly blended.

steps.headline: Add the ice, adding one cup at a time, and blending.
steps.description: Pulse the mixture to ensure the lemonade slushie forms.

steps.headline: Pour the lemonade slushie into serving glasses.
Chill the slushie in the fridge for about two hours till overnight.
Serve.
steps.description: Garnish the lemonade slushie with lemon zest and a lemon wedge. Enjoy!

steps.headline: In a blender, blend the lemon, water, strawberries and ice.
steps.description: Blend until well-combined and properly blended.

steps.headline: Pour and scrape the slushie mixture into a freezer-proof container.
Freeze the slushie mixture for about 12 hours till overnight.
Remove from freezer and allow the slushie to sit at room temperature for an hour.
Combine in the club soda with a wooden spoon.
Pour the lemonade slushie into serving glasses.
Serve.
steps.description: Garnish the lemonade slushie with a strawberry and a lemon wedge. Enjoy!

text: Basic Lemonade Slushie In a blender, blend the lemon, water, and sugar. Blend until well-combined and properly blended. Add the ice, adding one cup at a time, and blending. Pulse the mixture to ensure the lemonade slushie forms. Pour the lemonade slushie into serving glasses.  Chill the slushie in the fridge for about two hours till overnight.  Serve. Garnish the lemonade slushie with lemon zest and a lemon wedge. Enjoy! Strawberry Lemonade Slushie In a blender, blend the lemon, water, strawberries and ice. Blend until well-combined and properly blended. Pour and scrape the slushie mixture into a freezer-proof container. Close tightly with a lid. Freeze the slushie mixture for about 12 hours till overnight.  Remove from freezer and allow the slushie to sit at room temperature for an hour.  Combine in the club soda with a wooden spoon. Mix until well-combined. Pour the lemonade slushie into serving glasses.  Serve. Garnish the lemonade slushie with a strawberry and a lemon wedge. Enjoy! Raspberry Lemonade Slushie In a blender, blend the lemon juice, raspberries, and sugar. Blend until well-combined and properly blended. Add the ice, adding one cup at a time, and blending. Pulse the mixture to ensure the lemonade slushie forms. Pour the lemonade slushie into serving glasses.  Chill the slushie in the fridge for about two hours till overnight.  Serve. Garnish the lemonade slushie with lemon zest and a lemon wedge. Enjoy! Peach Lemonade Slushie In a blender, blend the lemon juice, peaches, and sugar. Blend until well-combined and properly blended. Add the ice cubes and blend. Pulse the mixture to ensure the lemonade slushie forms. Pour the lemonade slushie into serving glasses.  Chill the slushie in the fridge for about two hours till overnight.  Serve. Garnish the lemonade slushie with lemon zest and a peach slice. Enjoy! Watermelon Lemonade Slushie In a blender, blend the lemon juice and ice. Blend until well-combined and properly blended. Add the ice cubes and blend. Pulse the mixture to ensure the lemonade slushie forms. Pour the lemonade slushie into serving glasses.  Chill the slushie in the fridge for about two hours till overnight.  Serve. Garnish the lemonade slushie with lemon zest and a watermelon wedge. Enjoy!
